Description: Bowl. Decorated with interlacing pattern and floral motifs. Kufic and naskh inscription along circumference. Fritware (stonepaste); black and blue underglaze.
Curator's comments: Fritware bowl painted in black and blue under the glaze The inscription includes the date 610 AH/1213-14 AD Kashan, Iran
Bibliographic references: Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.84.B)
Pinder-Wilson 1952 / Recent Acquisitions of Islamic Pottery (p.81-82)
Stoke-On-Trent Museum and Art Gallery 1949 / Guide to the Collection of Early Islamic Pottery Lent by Sir Ernest Debenham, Bart, 1949 (p.8)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest Ridley Debenham, 1st Baronet
